nodes.bodyText: correct me if i'm wrong, but couldn't you do projectile.getItem().getAmount() and project.getItem().setAmount(amount)
I could, but the amount is always 1, so I decided to be consistent with the ItemFrameSlot class.

Looks like @ShaneBeee wrote that line and @FranKusmiruk actually brought up the same concern that I did but was resolved. In my opinion, Skript should allow the same access to implemented APIs as Java would (with the exception of stopping you from doing things that break the server). what do you guys think @Mr-Darth @FranKusmiruk @ShaneBeee?

While I normally agree that Skript should be more consistent with Bukkit, Skript is often doing things quite different than Bukkit would.
Also, if Im not mistaken, this method is generally used internally and not by the end user. I could be wrong.
Regardless, attempting to set the item stack amount to anything about 1, will just get ignored either way.
As Shane said, the item amount can't be any number but 1, so everything will work the same, no matter how it's implemented.
